intro: Calycosia petiolata, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, violet or purple petals surrounding a central disk of smaller florets, which are typically yellow. Calycosia petiolata thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in prairies and open woodlands. Its foliage is lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
